>>

>> A name =
is just a name. Because I put Edison on the box has no bearing on

r or not he actually achieved spirit communications. The SB#3 was labeled

as

>> The fact is, it is a scanning radio to try to pick up the voices from=
 spirits. 
>>Come on. bitching about a name. Glad my name isn't Edison.
>> =

>> For you Frank, not a single part of your circuit design went into SB#3.=
 I did 
>>analyze your design and found many flaws especially in the Random=
 noise circuit. 
>>For that reason alone, I could not use it. I am not tryi=
ng to put you down in

ing into the forefront.

>> I have been designing electronic circuits si=
nce I was 7yrs old. I am 41 now. I 
>>completely understand electronics and=
 love to push the limits of physics and 
>>beyond. This radio sweep circuit=
 is nothing. It is not complicated electronics 
>>at all. Just do a few cal=
culations to make sure you are amplifying and filtering 
>>correctly and bu=
ild. I find this rather basic.
>>

esign by using wood. Maybe I will use a 
>>different stain on the next one.=

>>

-scope., 
>>just so you can see for yourself, my circuit functions as I int=
ended it too.
>> 
>> If you would like, I can markup your schematics so you=
r random circuit will 
>>function correctly. You just need to remove and re=
place a component, and change 
>>a few values. Your random circuit was off =
right from the very first component. 
>>How can you possibly get a reliable=
 low frequency random noise circuit without 
>>using a known noise amount t=
o begin with?
>> 
>> I am not hear to bash anyone, and I do not expect that=
 myself. I am sorry you 
>>feel the way you do Frank, but you are entitled =
to feel how ever you want. If 
>>you would like to continue bashing, I can =
meet you blow for blow technically and 
>>I know I will win.
>> 
>> Enough =
said. I will back up my circuit with proof!
>> 
>> -Chris Felton

116@...
